byline.contributor: Rod Nordland reported from Al Rashid Air Base, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Omar Al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad, an Iraqi employee of The New York Times from Salahuddin Province and Peter Baker from Washington.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and HELENE COOPER

abstract: American airstrikes on Islamic State militants in Tikrit, Iraq, prompt boycott by Shiite militias, who have been leading that assault.
lead_paragraph: The groups, representing about a third of the 30,000 fighters, pulled out of the fight for Tikrit in protest of U.S. airstrikes.

headline.main: U.S. Airstrikes on ISIS in Tikrit Prompt Boycott by Shiite Fighters
headline.print_headline: U.S. Airstrikes on Tikrit Prompt Boycott, and Threats, by Shiite Fighters

snippet: The groups, representing about a third of the 30,000 fighters, pulled out of the fight for Tikrit in protest of U.S. airstrikes.
